definition: eye/small hole/crux (of a matter)/CL:隻|只[zhi1],雙|双[shuang1]/classifier for big hollow things (wells, stoves, pots etc)

sentences.english: The lines can include transformations and other sexiness.
sentences.chinese: 这些线可以包括转换以及其它吸引眼球的东西。

sentences.english: Globe rupture can occur secondary to blunt or penetrating trauma.
sentences.chinese: 眼球破裂可继发于钝挫伤或穿透性损伤。

sentences.english: Objective To evaluate echography appearances and diagnosis value of congenital abnormal of the eyeball wall.
sentences.chinese: 目的探讨眼球壁先天异常声像学表现及其诊断价值。

sentences.english: A betta's stomach is about the size of its eyeball, so take care not to feed your fish too much.
sentences.chinese: 斗鱼的胃和它的眼球大小相当，所以千万别喂的太多。

sentences.english: After removing eyeballs, peripheral blood was obtained by micro-injector.
sentences.chinese: 眼球摘除后微量进样器于眼窝处取外周血。

sentences.english: The zoomable eyeball camera is still, however, in its early stages.
sentences.chinese: 目前可变焦眼球摄像头仍是一个实验室产品。

sentences.english: Being the first, McDonald's is getting a lot of notoriety.
sentences.chinese: 作为第一个吃螃蟹者，麦当劳赢得了许多眼球。

sentences.english: Objective:To discuss the clinical effects of the lamellar keratoplasty for the treatment of ocular bomb injury.
sentences.chinese: 探讨板层角膜移植治疗眼球爆炸伤的临床效果。

sentences.english: Have black or blue metal accents for an eye-catching piece.
sentences.chinese: 蓝色和黑色更容易吸引人的眼球。

sentences.english: The most famous noses in the world were remarkable for both shape and size.
sentences.chinese: 世界上最著名的鼻子因为它的形状和大小而夺人眼球。

sentences.english: It's a helluva lot better than having tears on your eyeball.
sentences.chinese: 这都比眼球中有眼泪要好太多。

sentences.english: The electrical circuits are embedded in the lens which creates a display within the eyeball.
sentences.chinese: 镶嵌于镜片中的电流能在眼球之内形成图像。

sentences.english: In this respect, the arch across the top of the new stadium comes in handy.
sentences.chinese: 因为这一点，横架在新球场上空的拱梁十分吸引眼球。

sentences.english: The retina, the eye ball, everything was completely destroyed.
sentences.chinese: 视网膜，眼球等所有部分都被全部炸坏了。

sentences.english: Images are agood way to catch a visitors attention.
sentences.chinese: 图像历来是吸引眼球的不二法门。

sentences.english: People woken during these periods of eye-movements generally reported that they had been dreaming.
sentences.chinese: 在眼球活动期间醒来的人一般都说他们做了梦。

definition: amusing speech or act/jokes/antics/funny/amusing/Taiwan pr. [xue1 tou2]
attention/to stare at/to fix attention on sth
to increase followers/to get more fans
to fall over each other in their eagerness to...
